page.title: 01SOUTH AND EAST OF TURNBERRY
page.content: Turnberry is a small seaside village (pop. approx. 200), south of Turnberry Hotel with its 2 world-famous golf courses. The housing is mixed; half is council owned, some of the private houses are luxurious, many of the owners travelling to Girvan, Ayr etc. for employment. Local employment being in the hotel of on local farms. The farms are medium-sized on fairly hilly land, mainly engaged in cattle and sheep rearing. The fields are divided by the hedges, and there are some small streams and copses breaking up the landscape. Apart from an increased use of fertilisers the land use is traditional for the west coast of Scotland, as are the farm buildings. Apart from the 2 main roads the roads are single track, winding, but well signposted. The beach, which is sandy and rocky, is not easily accessible
